website_summaries.verdict: Extremely rugged winter boots by a trusted brand in outdoor gear. If you are looking for serious, waterproof winter boots, this is the pair to buy.
pros: Built to keep feet comfortable, dry, and warm in most conditions, thanks to the leather and synthetic materials crafted with waterproof seams
Rugged rubber soles offer superior traction
cons: May be a bit stiff and uncomfortable during the initial break-in period
Runs a bit small and tight on some men
Rare possible faulty pairs, as a few wearers report wet feet, but many more rave about them keeping feet dry

customer_reviews.title: My first pair lasted me for about 2 years (wearing almost every day in the winter in Alaska - approximatively one year of total
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Columbia Men's Bugaboot... My first pair lasted me for about 2 years (wearing almost every day in the winter in Alaska - approximatively one year of total wear every day) and I was very happy with the brand. Well unfortunately I cant say the same thing about this second pair that lasted only about 3 month. The laces lasted only about 2 month and the boots are already ruined.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Bear

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for a letter carrier
customer_reviews.text: Great boots! I'm a USPS letter carrier who does most to all of my routes on foot. Just bought these yesterday and they're great. Been walking in snow all day today and my feet were dry and comfortable. There's no breaking in period, they're already comfy and my feet are picky too so that's nice. Great tread too. Walked on lots of ice today too and they kept me as stable as any boot I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Oblak II

customer_reviews.title: Sober or drunk, these will keep your feet warm!
customer_reviews.text: The boot fits great, I feel invincible from about the ankle down. I put them on with my robe when they arrived in the mail and I stood in a snowbank with an outside temp of roughly ~20 degrees (F). I stood there for about 10-15 minutes, and even with normal socks my feet felt warm. I was drinking at the time, hence the robe, but still, I think my feet would have been warm sober, too.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Wofford

customer_reviews.title: Bugaboot iii vs ii comparison review.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldve given 5 stars if it was just about the looks. I had to compare this with bugaboot ii and made me return this cause of the comfort level. I don't know about what this would do in winter but both says -25 so would it matter one has Omni heat and the other doesn't. The problem with this was lack of cushioning or comfort the ii had. This looked good and solid but after wearing them for almost an hour had to go with ii. And that might also explain the pricing ( ii was more than iii at the time of purchase).
customer_reviews.author: Ton

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend these boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband as we just moved to Buffalo, NY and he needed a good pair of snow boots. He's worn them a few times a loves them. They are quick off and on (a huge plus) and very comfortable. They were true to his normal size. Being Columbia, I know they are good quality and definitely feel like it when you look at them in person. I suspect they will last a long time and are very warm for our cold winters
customer_reviews.author: whataryderTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great boot!
customer_reviews.text: Great boot. Received today right on time for today's first snowfall in Michigan. Paired with some wool socks. My feet stayed warm all through out sledding with the kids. Fresh powder, these boots were able to cut through snow w/o issue. No grip loss. These boots are tall. And snug around the lower calf muscle. Your ankle will be secure in these. So expect to feel like a robot, but your feet will be protected from the deepest of snow and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made boots
customer_reviews.text: I wore these for the first time on a snowy weekend in Minnesota. I did not do anything crazy in them. Just in and out of the car or to the hotel. These things are cheaply made! Buy some Morrells if you want some quality snow boots.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar A Zamora

customer_reviews.title: I'll never purchase Columbia boots again.
customer_reviews.text: I will never purchase Columbia boots again. I purchased this boots from amazon.com last November and got it through the freight forwarder in Mongolia. In Mongolia winter take place from December to March also so cold -15 to -35 celsius degrees cold. What I experienced from this boots is 1. My legs sweated just after wear it within 5 minutes(i think this boots does not breathe) and gradually make you feel cold. It was not keep my legs warm more than 20 minutes. 2. So inconvenient to drive a car due to inflexibility. 3. Uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Erdenetugs 99995551

customer_reviews.title: Decent boot, but not well constructed
customer_reviews.text: It's a good boot. I rarely wear these and have had them for two years. They still look new because I don't do any rough work with them, I go pretty gentle. I have found disappointment in them within the last few weeks as the inside "omniheat" has separated at the seam where my heel slides in. It's really a bummer they are out of warranty at this point because this is a manufacturer workmanship issue that I won't be able to remedy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, high quality build, and appears to be waterproof
customer_reviews.text: AFTER ordering, I was suddenly afraid these boots might be too tight, especially with thick socks. I ordered them to exact size based on my sneaker fit and was pleasantly surprised. These fit like a dream for comfort. The only VERY small criticism is the high tops are very rigid, which might put some customers off. It takes getting used to, but I actually prefer them this way. As far as other features go, the laces are good quality and the boots do appear to be decently waterproof up to about the tongue heel. I haven't tested beyond that point :) However, these will be exactly what I wanted them for - shoveling snow and pushing the snow blower.
customer_reviews.author: AtriumXP

customer_reviews.title: Ice boots, not. 👎
customer_reviews.text: Was expecting better. Used for meat production company. Havnt found boots to keep my feet from freezing. Stand on dry ice for @4-6 hrs 4 days a week. Within @ 30 mins feet freeze an stay froze rest of night. These boots were promising from description but no 👎 even 2 pairs of socks dont help. Plus they are slippery on wet floors. 👎👎 will not buy again. Wont say dont buy but buy at your own descretion. After wearing 4 days tossed in garage. Maybe rodent will make use of them.
customer_reviews.author: Basilio Nava

customer_reviews.title: Light-weight and comfortable, but dangerous clip for laces can catch on things
customer_reviews.text: These winter boots are great. Extremely light weight. They were quite stiff at first, but broke in after a few winter hikes. Very comfortable now. My only complaint is actually kind of serious: the top hooks catch on things too easily. I was navigating through snow on a hike and my two feet ended up right next to each other, but the metal hook on one boot caught on the metal hook of the other, and I stumbled and fell. I got very lucky, because I could have had a really, really bad fall. I now only wear these when I have clothing covering the top of the boot, as opposed to tucked in.
customer_reviews.author: Inconclusive Panda

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and comfortable. They look perfect for the snow but since it hasn't been snowing in NY city, I can't comment on how well they perform in those conditions. I normally wear a 13 wide and the 13 reg width fit fine. I'm very picky about arch support, especially since I have plantar fasciitis. The arch support in these is typical of virtually all boots I have tried. Decent but not good enough for me. It probably won't be an issue to you though. I will be adding arch pads to mine. I love these boots so far and look forward to taking on the next snowstorm mother nature throws at me.
customer_reviews.author: Mike F.

customer_reviews.title: Did I mention Warm and Dry?
customer_reviews.text: Feet were warm and dry while clearing our recent snow... These boots fit nicely, are comfortable, look nice, and do exactly what they are supposed to: Keeping feet warm and dry. Looking forward to using them on my next Yosemite winter photo-shoot.
customer_reviews.author: William H. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These boots are keeping my feet warm and comfortable at sub-zero temperatures. The omni-heat makes a huge difference compared to my old Columbias. The boots fit perfectly regardless of whether I am wearing thick or thin socks. The waterproofing is effective as the inside of my boots remain when snow melts after coming inside.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable - Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I took the advice of a lot of buyers on sizing up and they fit perfectly. I'm a 10 1/2 Wide so I got size 11 1/2. Great fit. No foot sliding or lifting inside the boots. They are lighter than I thought they'd be. Replacing a pair of Columbia's I've had for 15 years and find the new ones much more comfortable to walk in. I'm very happy with my choice. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend. I live in an area that experiences subzero ...
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend. I live in an area that experiences subzero temperatures. My feet and toes do not get cold. Many are complaining that the new boot will rub raw areas of your ankle or above. This should be expected with most quality boots. You will have to break these in. If you're buying these for immediate prolonged use, make sure to not tighten the boot all the way and wear thick socks to avoid rubbing.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D. Fettel

customer_reviews.title: Boots would seem to do their job in the snow!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased several pairs of winter boots VIA Amazon's Prime Wardrobe to take onto a trip up in the Swiss alps and I just chose to opt to go with a different pair of boots. There was nothing wrong with these, I just took other factors into consideration such as price, fit with my socks, and length of the boot up my leg. These boots I believe would have done their job as needed in the snow!
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: I was glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today. Ordered one size bigger based upon prior reviews. I was glad I did. Can still wear heavier socks but the room in the boot is perfect. Construction seems excellent and for the short time I had them on the boots seemed very comfortable. Would recommend purchasing them if you require good boots for outside use working or plowing.
customer_reviews.author: Trout Boy

customer_reviews.title: Within 2 weeks falling apart cracks all over and cant ...
customer_reviews.text: Within 2 weeks falling apart cracks all over and cant even keep feet dry or warm do not get these. They wont even do anything to compensate me for these poorly made boots. these are a waste of money what ever you do dont buy them
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves these boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband who’s old Mickey Mouse military/airman’s boots finally died. He was so cranky and skeptical—wanted the same pair as before. However, these were a revelation for him and he’s now super happy about his warm, dry feet, laces that don’t have to be double-knotted, and the light weight of the boot (compared to the old boots which were like lead bricks...) Win I think? :3
customer_reviews.author: Kate the Great!

customer_reviews.title: Good cold weather and snow boot
customer_reviews.text: Took this to Yellowknife canada for trail hiking and snow great comfortable boot. I rated this for the outdoors only not for driving. The stiffness doesn't allow you to drive well but you can just need to be aware of it and bring an extra pair of tennis shoe. I did that any one cause not all the places I want to wear the boot.
customer_reviews.author: macgeardude

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING boots. Read several reviews from around the web ...
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING boots. Read several reviews from around the web prior to buying. Between these boots and regular no show ankle socks, my feet stay warm in the coldest temps. Tested waterproofness by having on no socks and sticking foot in bathtub filled with water. Even while fully submerged, my foot was dry. Would recommend these boots to other hopeful buyers. They do ok on ice. For my job(car carrier) I can walk up and down my decks without issues. Boots are a little bulkier than I'm used too, but not too heavy. Ordered size 11 based off my shoe size, and was perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Water Proof and Awesome Traction
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly, a bit stiff when new but I am sure it will break in after general use. Comments regarding insulation seem to be on par, does well in the 20F-35F range. Recent East Coast snow storm and cold weather (was 5F-15F), these boots didnt insulate well. I had to use toe warmers, but as a Skier this wasn't a total inconvenience. These boots have great grio on slick and icy surfaces, and definitely are highly water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: N. M. S.

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: My toe hurts when wearing these. I'd go a half size bigger. I would have returned them but needed them for a trip.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Evans

customer_reviews.title: Warm, Dry, Fits.
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. These are the first pair of snow boots that I've owned. It fits just as I had expected (ordered my normal shoe size) and they keep my feet dry and extremely warm even in really cold weather, wading through snow. It does feel a bit cumbersome because it's really rigid and I'm not used to high shoes, but the warmth and dryness is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Really good boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son and he loves them. We live up in a ski town in Utah and we have had a ton of snow this year and it's been rather cold as well. His feet stay warm and dry and he keeps on telling me how happy his is with his new boots. He's been out in 4 foot drifts and stays dry. As far as warmth - if you are going to be out in sub-zero temps for extended periods - I'd get something with more insulation. Overall - we are very happy with these boots.
customer_reviews.author: ParkCity Skier

customer_reviews.title: Winter combat boots for the war on winter and snow!
customer_reviews.text: Great winter boots! Kept my feet warm during some cold days in Chicago (winter 2016). We had some heavy snow fall so I liked that it prevented snow from getting inside my boots, keeping my feet warm and dry! The material of the boots feels very strong, feels like it will last me many winters. They do feel heavy on the feet but will worth it to keep my feet warm and toasty. Thank you Columbia for making a awesome winter boot! I always trust a Columbia brand!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Z

customer_reviews.title: The Kamik was more comfortable (felt like wearing a pillow)
customer_reviews.text: Compared these side by side with the Kamik Blackjack (2015). The Kamik was more comfortable (felt like wearing a pillow), but I liked the overall look and construction quality on the Columbia better. I ordered a size 9 thinking it would be good to go larger for use with thicker socks, but it was overkill and even with thick socks my actual size was much more comfy. So... fit was exactly as expected, but I returned and got the Bugaboot III Titanium OH in my actual size.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Rugged Cevalar
customer_reviews.text: I'm a tower tech and I wear a boot out before a year's time and so far I havent came close to tearing them up. I normally in the winter deal with temps of 30 to -10 degress and winds of 15 to 35 Mph at times and with the combination of the two this boot stands tough to the climate. Outstanding boot so far "recommend".
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Bring on the snow!
customer_reviews.text: The boots run slightly larger than my normal shoe size. Not too big that I cannot wear them, but they have enough room to accommodate thicker socks. They are stiff and need time to get broken in. Overall the fit is good, they are comfortable and warm. I am looking forward to the cold winter season.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Warm + fits really well
customer_reviews.text: Super warm! I am a sized 12, bought a 12, and am really happy with the fit. Just enough tow room for thick socks. Really like the traction as well. The back of the boot is super stiff (almost feels like ski boots--drop a star for that), so walking takes some getting use to. I have now worn three times and am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: W. G.

customer_reviews.title: After a few weeks now, they are not that comfortable and no way are these meant for any deep freeze temps.
customer_reviews.text: Received these two days ago. I am an inspector for a local water utility. Spent the last two days in 6" of milk shake like mud. Feet stayed dry. Insoles provide no support, replaced with wool Super feet. They run narrow which is good for me. The heel cup is hard and flat. For the $65 cyber Monday they hopefully will be fine for the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Indy

customer_reviews.title: Keep my feet toasty
customer_reviews.text: My Christmas present to myself. These are amazing! Fit beautifully and keep my feet warm when I’m outside shoveling. I finally decided to splurge a little after a lifetime of buying “lower cost” winter boots but having the cheap ones not really cut it for the winter months. The Columbia boots look great and feel great - no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Darren

customer_reviews.title: Good boots but they ran small.
customer_reviews.text: They really are great boots, I owned a pair before I bought these. Downside was this new pair ran small for some reason and the same size didn't fit. Had to send them back, might reorder.
customer_reviews.author: HappyCamper

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love these. They look great and fit well. Exactly what I was looking for at the right price. It hasn't snowed and hasn't been that cold since I purchased them a couple weeks ago so I can't comment on the warmth. However, given the reflective liner and other reviews, I'm confident I'll remain happy with them when the temperature drops. Great to have the quick-lace capability at the top of the boot too. The treads are designed to grip the surface which is something I've never seen before. Pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Overall these are probably the best winter boots I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Overall these are probably the best winter boots I've owned. I wore them on a winter camping trip last week. They provided good traction while I was dragging a sled, worked well with my snowshoes, and kept my feet warm all day. The width is a bit snug, but that is partially due to me wearing heavy wool socks and liner socks. If in doubt, go up half a size. Definitely recommend. I will buy another pair whenever I wear these out.
customer_reviews.author: Winston Smith

customer_reviews.title: Horrible painful and can’t even return
customer_reviews.text: Hurts. That’s all I can say / wear them for a day and you’ll have bruises up and down your legs. Oh and you can’t return them after you find out. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots, this is my second par. I still have the first par and they are broken in well and feel good, but over the years have a small crack in one side of the toe bend area and no longer are water resistant. The new pair are in the brake in period, but feel good and are water proof. Great pair of boots..
customer_reviews.author: Rikster

customer_reviews.title: Great winter shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I just got my Omni Heat boots, so I can't be sure about the durability of this product, but I believe in Columbia Omni Heat line. Boots feet like a glove out of the box. I'm dead size 11 and boots are right on the spot with size. Chicago cold winter didn't hit yet, so no words for how good boots are in winter. However, this is not my first Columbia product. I have Omni Heat jacket for good 8 seasons, and it still going strong. As of right now. 5 stars, will keep you guys posted if any changes. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DB2927

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: They were much lighter than I expected, having not tried them on before purchasing. I took a gamble since most shoes I found in stores had terrible reviews. These boots serve their purpose well (playing with my kids in the snow / sledding, snow shoveling, etc...) They are comfortable enough to wear throughout the day, but because they are waterproof they don't breath well (as expected). They kept my feet warm without wearing thick socks. I walked through some water covering the toe of this boot and my feet stayed completely dry. I like the styling of these over all the other Columbia boots. Extremely pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: NTP

customer_reviews.title: Great winter boot
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband for when he shovels snow or walks the dogs out in the snow/cold. He really likes how the top of the shoe are hooks rather than holes for the laces; it makes it much easier to get the on and snug. He's very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy A

customer_reviews.title: Updated review.
customer_reviews.text: Update: after 2 winters the sole has started to separate from the boot. The place guides are pulling through three stitching. Was hoping to, at least. Get 3 seasons out of them. I will buy more expensive boots from here on out. Very comfortable. Very water resistant/proof. Seems to be well made (so far). Definitely not as warm as advertised. It's been 8°F for 2 days and my toes have been cold. -25°F will be exciting......
customer_reviews.author: william keiler

customer_reviews.title: Good Boot. Good Bye.
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a 10.5 so I got an 11 based on reviews; glad I did. The 11 fit well. The shoe is a good shoe and kept my feet warm and dry. Wore in the snow in about 45 degree weather. Sadly, I returned the boots because one of the shoelace mounts tore off. It was probably a quality anomaly since I haven't read that the same has been reported by other users.
customer_reviews.author: ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: They fit fine... perhaps a tad roomy, but that's what I expected. I wear anywhere between a 10-11, and ordered a 10.5. It has enough room for thick socks. Wore them a few times and good so far. nothing major to complain about. But this is by no means a long-term review.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: These gave good traction in powdery snow
customer_reviews.text: Bought and wore these on a trip to Big Bear near Los Angeles. These gave good traction in powdery snow, but in icy or mushy snow the traction is not so good, and I had to be careful not to fall from sliding around. The fit is nice and the shoes are comfortable with a semi-thick pair of socks. Overall I would recommend these for comfort and for powdery snow conditions, but be more careful in wet snow.
customer_reviews.author: Terrie

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Not waterproof, Even in light sprinkle rain and/or lightly wet ground with no occurring rain! Completely wet on the inside of boots on the first time in wet conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected...
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for a trip to Iceland, Temps not even that cold approx 30 F. Feet felt cold, water got in even when just standing in 3 inches of water (supposed to be waterproof up to ankle). All in all not a good experience when ice cold water gets your feet wet on a full day photo shoot! I love Columbia but this boots do not live up expectations
customer_reviews.author: ALESSANDRO MENCOS

customer_reviews.title: Small fit
customer_reviews.text: I needed to return these because they were to tight in the toe box and they didn't come in a wider size. But I thought they were nice looking and the quality was good, so if they fit I'd still have them and give them five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Hammerhead

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: The first night I wore them it was 10 below zero. I had to change out my heavier sock because my feet were sweating. With just a regular pair of socks my feet stayed warm all night that I spent out doors which was close to four hours. No more feet warmer inserts. The boots look great and do not have the appearance of the typical big and clumpy. They feel very comfortable. What a great treat for our cold weather in North Dakota. P.S. These were bought for my husband.
customer_reviews.author: kelli canson

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof Enough
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots primarily for cold wet winter football games and hiking around the hilly college campus. On their first, and only outing, fit well, were comfortable, and feet were initially warm and dry in the 28F raining/snowing weather. But as the rain turned to snow, and really started coming down, my feet were wet and cold by the fourth quarter. Boots weren't able to make it through an entire game so I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves these boots! He has been wearing ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these boots! He has been wearing them out in the snowy & blowy Michigan weather with no complaints. Keep his feet warm and have held up so far. He also thinks they look "cool" which is also a plus! ;)
customer_reviews.author: CoryThursday

customer_reviews.title: Good Boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots will definitely keep your feet warm. I tried them in 40 degree weather and 10 degree weather and they felt exactly the same. They are very rigid. They will have to be broken in over time. They look good and feel pretty good. The insole is a little hard for all day use but I changed mine after a few days.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great snow/waterproof boot!
customer_reviews.text: These are great warm snow boots! Not much in the way of fashion but definitely do what they are supposed to do. Husband loved them and said they were very warm. Pants would go down over these boots as they are not bulky like most which is a plus for more daily wear.
customer_reviews.author: Slaybackfamily

customer_reviews.title: Four wheel drive for feet
customer_reviews.text: Great great pair of cold weather boots - super comfortable, lotsa padding, very very lightweight for a winter boot, good lacing, nice deep lugs, ultra - waterproof, sturdy and kinda affordable but we'll worth the money I work outside all year round and this is without a doubt one of my best Amazon purchases
customer_reviews.author: ruski3:16

customer_reviews.title: Works great in below zero Minnesota weather
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these in women's from amazon and they are the warmest boots I have ever owned. Works great in below zero Minnesota weather. Purchased the male ones when my husband asked for a new pare of sorels. He agrees the warmest most comfortable winter boots he has had as well.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: I love the look of these and they've held up really ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of these and they've held up really well so far during this Chicago winter. I do wish I had ordered a half-size bigger: with thin socks these are snug, but if you try to wear them with thick wool socks, they're just bordering on too tight. They seem to be sturdy and well made, and have been keeping my feet warm even without wool socks.
customer_reviews.author: Fritz

customer_reviews.title: The product is rated to up to withstand -25 deg ...
customer_reviews.text: The product is rated to up to withstand -25 deg Celsius. It was -7 deg Celsius in Toronto today and my feet were cold ! I was surprised given the ratings and the fact that it is the highest selling boot on Amazon.com.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will Keep Your Feet Toasty and Sweaty In 0° and Below
customer_reviews.text: What is the point of a waterproof boot that reflects nearly all your body heat back to you and fills up with sweat after a couple hours? This boot takes a long while to dry out and I have bacteria eating at my feet if it doesn't dry out before my shift the next day. My socks are soaked and stink after wear and I have only had a stink problem once before in my teens. I switched to thicker wool socks but that only increased the comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought these as a gift for my son, but I’ve been wearing these boots for the past 5 years. They are the warmest boots I’ve ever had by far, and still appear to have a few more years in them. I don’t work outside, but I wear them every time I go out in the cold. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Kay

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: One of the most excellent products I've ever bought through Amazon. It fits better than I expected, unlike other shoes which will come too narrow or not of the exact same color shades. The supplier/shipper would have got 7 stars from me...
customer_reviews.author: Elias Muchuma Niva

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good Fit
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good fit. I bought my pair a little large(1/2 size) so I could add an insole insert. These boots were lighter than I expected too. Very happy Bugaboot Plus III boot.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Damn good boat for long treks to my work in a Minnesota winter.
customer_reviews.text: Damn good light and durable boot for long treks to my work in a Minnesota winter. This boot might not hold up to standing around in sub-zeros unless you have really thick warm socks but on the move it is great. I wish the Bugaboot Plus III had more color options. Price was good.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen  Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Great winter boots.
customer_reviews.text: Have kept me warm and dry all winter in northern michigan. Even snowmobiling for 8 hours at 5 degrees. Used with just a single pair of people socks...I recommend those as well. Never noticed any water inside. They are pretty comfortable and light for.....a heavy boot. When I first started wearing them they did feel a little clunky and stiff but they loseen up....and most times I don't realize they are heavy boots.
customer_reviews.author: $am n €had

customer_reviews.title: Great winter boots!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my husband for winter and he loves them. I was worried about ordering boots online but they were absolutely perfect. He wore them every chance he could over the winter season and they are holding up great!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: They are really comfortable they aren't as heavy as the sorrel boots they ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this boots a size 11 and they perfectly fit my brother's feet even though he is a size 10 so piece of advice buy this boots about 1/2-1 size bigger. They are really comfortable they aren't as heavy as the sorrel boots they really take on the snow, we've had tons of snow and my brother hasn't complained about them whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Galvan

customer_reviews.title: Be Sure to Check the Width Size before buying!
customer_reviews.text: I like the Brand and the Quality. However, the boots were way too narrow and had to return them for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight boot and very warm.
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple pairs of these boots. They are very lightweight, waterproof and very warm. Definitely a must-have here in northern Minnesota. The Omni-Heat works great and decreases the need for heavy or bulky insulation, making these shoes quite comfortable. I use them all winter long for everything from clearing snow to hiking and snow-shoeing.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. ZahoroskyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boot for Northern Maine"s winter challenges.
customer_reviews.text: Best winter boot I've owned to date. Perfect for our Northern Maine winters. Wear them whenever I intend to stay outside for an extended period of time, going through heavy, deep snow, going through slush or walking on ice. Very Comfortable for me and they have not caused me any what I call "boot fatigue" from extended wear.
customer_reviews.author: jerry riley

customer_reviews.title: 5 and thats what I ordered and they fit perfect. They are warm and water resistant
customer_reviews.text: Greats boots I wear a 9.5 and thats what I ordered and they fit perfect. They are warm and water resistant. I have stomped in puddles and waded across little streams and no wet. I did once to purposely stand in about 8 inches of water and you could tell on the tongue that I needed to get out after a couple seconds but they met all my expectations
customer_reviews.author: Clay Cutler

customer_reviews.title: Prefect for snow
customer_reviews.text: These boots are incredible. I ordered a half size bigger (normally wear 10.5 so I got 11) and they fit perfectly. I don't think you really need thick wool socks with them to stay warm. I love that they go up kinda high because it keeps snow out. I have received multiple compliments on them and I don't see myself ever buying a different boot for the snow again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Best

customer_reviews.title: Took them out in some -10 degree weather and they did awesome! I love them
customer_reviews.text: Little big but thats ok. Took them out in some -10 degree weather and they did awesome! I love them? And comfortable as can be. A little taugnt in the ankles at first till you break them in. Great traction too. Climbed a pretty steep angle snowy moutain side while doing some sledding and didn't really slip.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: 3 Year Review- Highly Recommended;Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: I have used the same pair for almost three years straight for work. No signs of normal wear and tear up at all. Great as a work boot, hiking boot, general boot,etc. Built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: They are a very comfortable boot. I have done some hiking with them and they provide good traction and feel very comfortable. I was worried that they may be a little wide since I have narrow feet (B) but they fit pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: flymutt

customer_reviews.title: Warm and dry.
customer_reviews.text: These are a great and durable pair of boots. I used these both commercially and to shovel my own driveway. No leaks and leaks and they kept me warm for more than eight hours. A little stiff but it's worth being warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: #rd pair....
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic boot,,,, this is my 3rd pr.,,,, Here in east Tn we get a lot of rain in the winter ,,, these boot keep my feet dry an warm.... Would recommend to anybody....
customer_reviews.author: Dale Moore

customer_reviews.title: They didn't even last 3 months...not happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for my husband for christmas, and they started out great. They're light weight and great in the cold weather, but they already have a hole in the side and now his feet get wet. I want to replace them and am now unable to do so. I'm not happy about this purchase now, I expected these to last a lot longer since they are columbia brand boots, but they did not even last 3 whole months!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: We love this item and would buy again. My son says his feet stay warm and dry. He’s a Boy Scout and they camp outside for days at a time in winter. 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Holland Girl

customer_reviews.title: size is small
customer_reviews.text: Purchased size 10 Mens( I wear 9.5 shoe) should have got a size bigger. It would be ok if you only wear one pair socks. I usually wear 2 , wicking socks under Merino wool.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Morris

customer_reviews.title: I could comfortably wear thick wool socks with them
customer_reviews.text: Kept me warm and dry all winter. I live 15 miles from Glacier National Park In Columbia Falls, Montana. I was outside almost every day this winter in snow and down to -20 at times, and they didn't fail me once or let my feet get cold. I could comfortably wear thick wool socks with them.
customer_reviews.author: Aron Wilburn

customer_reviews.title: Update: DO NOT BUY, FEET WILL GET WET
customer_reviews.text: Boots are comfortable not water proof ,your feet will get wet
customer_reviews.author: gunman

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed in these boots
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in these boots. The reason why I purchased these boots were to keep my feet warm. The current temperature is 68 Degrees and my feet are cold. I am also wearing two pairs of sock. I would not recommend these boots. I wish I can return and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are very light which is nice, look well made
customer_reviews.text: They were bought as a Christmas gift and they fit well. They are very light which is nice, look well made. I'm not sure what it is called but they have those silver dots inside to help keep your feet warm, a Columbia feature that is also in some of their clothes. I am really happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots but just plain uncomfortable for me
customer_reviews.text: These are well made boots and really light but I find them really uncomfortable above the ankle around the base of my legs when I've had them on for an hour or so. I've tried them with thick socks and fastened up either tightly or loosely but can't seem to overcome this problem. They just seem to rub and become unpleasant to wear for some reason and I've never had this issue with other boots. Really disappointing as these boots seemed to be very highly rated in the reviews I'd read.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Harris

customer_reviews.title: Not a good boot
customer_reviews.text: Not as expected feet were always cold not water proof not a good boot at all
customer_reviews.author: Tony cushman

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and keeps feet warm
customer_reviews.text: Husband wore these the other day to shovel snow for a few hours. We got about 8" this go-round. We live up in the Rocky Mountains. He said they fit really nice and they kept his feet nice and toasty. What more can you ask for? He has a pair of Sorrels that just were so bulky and ran large--but wore them for a few years anyways. He wanted a pair that he could use as an all-around good snow shoe. These are stream-lined enough for him to use in his snowshoes. They work great!
customer_reviews.author: bellabella

customer_reviews.title: Stiff, but warm, and seem like they will hold up
customer_reviews.text: These are really stiff- I have worn them 2-3 times thus far, and they are still abnormally stiff. I have yet to wear them in really cold conditions, but think they may not be as warm as my last Columbia's.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Hutton

customer_reviews.title: ... and he said to me that these were the best snow boots I ever bought you where is lightweight ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband helps the neighborhood snow blowing and he said to me that these were the best snow boots I ever bought you where is lightweight socks and they're totally waterproof totally warm and he's outside doing this sometimes for six hours he will buy again when they wear out
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Oursler

customer_reviews.title: A Good Waterproof Moderately Cold Weather Boot
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be more pleased with these boots. They are comfortable, provide good foot support, reasonable protection, decent warmth, and are both truly waterproof and reasonably breatheable. They are easy to get into and out of, with only two pairs of hooks that need lacing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Riversong

customer_reviews.title: but these paired with some nice wool socks keeps my feet nice and toasty in ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried these on in a store first just to be sure of the size. Yeah, I'm that guy. I had Amazon credit to spend though, otherwise I wouldn't have been that guy. The snow hasn't come yet, but these paired with some nice wool socks keeps my feet nice and toasty in the cold. The out-sole is super tacky (not bad looking, but sticky) due to the soft rubber compound. Like winter tires, the rubber is softer to allow for better traction in the snow. It's a stiffer boot in the ankle, but doesn't go up high enough that it causes problems with mobility. They don't look too bad either!
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice boot. Excellent feel and great quality. Will order again for my son next year for Christmas
customer_reviews.author: Ann M. Emery

customer_reviews.title: I have sneakers that perform better in every aspect
customer_reviews.text: Not worth 1 star but had to give it 1 so I could submit a review. . Absolute junk. Uncomfortable, only waterproof on the bottoms and not warm at all. I have sneakers that perform better in every aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I work at a ski resort, so i am usually knee deep in snow. i thought from the specs itd be perfect for the job, i was wrong. i works in light snow, but not the harsh conditions it says it can. i was around -5 and the boots failed me (says can stand up to -30) they let water in, and the water made my toes freezing cold. since they are made in china i am assuming its just poor craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: reed miller

customer_reviews.title: Warm & Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very warm. Comfortable (with low or high socks). Good Traction. Strong wear resistance. Cons: The laces come undone if not double knotted. I would prefer eyelets in lieu of hooks at the top to ease this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great boot for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a boot for snowshoeing and these are ranked as the best for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M

customer_reviews.title: Good boots
customer_reviews.text: It was time to retire the Sorels and wanted something a little lighter and easier to pack for a trip. These boots worked perfectly in -20 weather in Toronto and Montreal. My feet were cold but I should have probably worn thicker wool socks but no issue with slipping or water intrusion at all.
customer_reviews.author: Scott N

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, super warm.
customer_reviews.text: Really warm, had to take them off 30 min after putting them on as I was sweating.. Just need to break them in. Currently the boot stabs a bit into the top of my arch but should reduce once broken in.
customer_reviews.author: GaVetGp84

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot.
customer_reviews.text: This a great warm light weight boot. I live in Minnesota and find the boot perfect.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Hands down best boots I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Hands down best boots I have ever owned. Would definitely be getting these again I where them 5 days a week and had them for about 8 months now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: They fit as expected, are waterproof, and warm. I work outside and would expect nothing less than perfection from Columbia. My last pair lasted over 10 years. Hoping to get the same out of these!
customer_reviews.author: MDG

product_meta.title: Columbia Men's Bugaboot Plus III Omni Cold-Weather Boot
product_meta.description: Columbia offers a wide variety of outdoor performance footwear, outerwear, sportswear, and accessories. Columbia products are engineered using the best technologies and highest quality materials, providing you with innovative products that are functional yet stylish and a great value.
feature_bullets: Ankle-high cold-weather boot with waterproof seam-sealed construction featuring Omni-Heat reflective lining with 200g insulation
Techlite lightweight midsole for long lasting comfort, superior cushioning, and high energy return
